totalStocksPL.title: Total Stocks P&L
totalStocksPL.description: This represents your total profit or loss from stock trading. A positive value means you made a profit, but capital gains taxes must be paid on profitable trades. Losses can be used to offset gains for tax purposes.

totalDividendsGross.title: Total Dividends (Gross)
totalDividendsGross.description: This is the total amount of dividends you received before any taxes were deducted. Dividends are subject to income tax and may also have withholding taxes from foreign countries.

dividendTaxes.title: Dividend Taxes
dividendTaxes.description: This shows the total amount of taxes withheld from your dividends by foreign countries. These withholding taxes can often be claimed as tax credits to reduce your domestic tax liability.

totalAcquisition.title: Total Acquisition
totalAcquisition.description: This is the total amount you spent purchasing stocks during the tax year. This includes the purchase price of shares but excludes trading fees and commissions.

totalRealized.title: Total Realized
totalRealized.description: This is the total amount you received from selling stocks during the tax year. This is the gross proceeds from your stock sales before deducting the original purchase price and expenses.

tradeExpenses.title: Trade Expenses
tradeExpenses.description: These are the fees and commissions you paid for buying and selling stocks. These expenses can be deducted from your capital gains to reduce your taxable amount.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Stock and Dividend Taxes
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about using IRSimples for your tax calculations

whatIsIRSimples.question: What is IRSimples?
whatIsIRSimples.answer: IRSimples is a platform that helps investors in Portugal to calculate, simply and rigorously, the income obtained from stocks. Our algorithms have been validated by a team of specialized accountants, allowing automatic calculation and generation of all information necessary for IRS declarations.

howDoesItHelp.question: How does IRSimples help investors?
howDoesItHelp.answer1: Submitting IRS reports is a complex and bureaucratic process that requires detailed knowledge of annexes and access to all purchase and sale information from brokers. Additionally, capital gains reports provided by brokers â€” especially foreign ones â€” do not always follow the tax rules applicable in Portugal (FIFO).
howDoesItHelp.answer2: For the calculation to be correct, it is necessary to gather the complete history of all transactions and calculate, from the beginning, gains and losses. However, annual broker reports rarely include details of purchase and sale dates, which can lead to loss of tax benefits, since the number of years you hold a stock directly influences the taxes to pay.
howDoesItHelp.answer3: IRSimples aims to simplify and automate this entire process through direct import of purchase and sale transactions from brokers. The platform automatically performs all capital gains calculations, ensuring accuracy, time savings, and compliance with Portuguese law.

whyNotBrokerReports.question: Why do I need IRSimples and annual broker reports are not enough?
whyNotBrokerReports.answer1: Most annual broker reports only present the aggregated net result (P/L) or, at most, the P/L per stock, without details of each purchase and sale transaction. This causes loss of information about which sold stocks were already held for more than 2 years â€” which can bring tax advantages:
whyNotBrokerReports.taxRateOver8: Stocks held for more than 8 years: 19.6%

whyUseBeforeYearEnd.question: Why should I use IRSimples before the end of the year?
whyUseBeforeYearEnd.answer: Take advantage of easily calculating your P/L at the end of the year to evaluate the possibility of selling open positions at a loss and thus reduce taxable gains. Even if you want to keep the stock, nothing prevents you from selling at a loss and buying back immediately after. You will pay transaction commissions, but this strategy can help you reduce taxes if you have other profitable sales in the same fiscal year.

supportedBrokers.question: Which brokers are supported?
supportedBrokers.answer: Currently, IRSimples supports two international brokers: DEGIRO and T212. Additionally, you can manually add transactions through an Excel template. We are working to soon integrate more brokers into the platform.

unsupportedBroker.question: If my broker is not supported, how can I use IRSimples?
unsupportedBroker.answer: If your broker is not yet available, you can subscribe to the Premium plan. In this case, our team handles manual analysis of your transactions and generates the necessary data for the capital gains report.

supportedAnnexes.question: Which IRS annexes are supported and automatically generated?
supportedAnnexes.answer: Currently, IRSimples only generates Annex J of the IRS, which includes capital gains and dividends received through foreign brokers. We are working to soon integrate the generation of annexes G and E into the platform.

onlyCurrentYear.question: Can I submit only the transactions from the fiscal year under analysis?
onlyCurrentYear.answer: No. You must submit the entire history since the account opening, because sales may be linked to purchases from previous years.

portugueseDividends.question: Why don't dividends from Portuguese companies appear in the report generated by IRSimples?
portugueseDividends.answer: Dividends from Portuguese companies are subject to a 28% withholding tax at source, already applied by the financial intermediary, which functions as a definitive liberating tax. Therefore, it is not necessary to declare them in the IRS, except if you opt for the aggregation of these incomes.

cost.question: What is the cost of IRSimples?
cost.answer: IRSimples can be used for free up to the limit of 5 capital gains reports. From that limit, and if you need specialized support, you can subscribe to the Premium plan.

manualSupport.question: Can I have support and manual review by a specialized accountant?
manualSupport.answer: Yes. Our Premium plan allows you to validate your submission manually, with direct support from our specialized accountants.

dataSecurity.question: Where is my data stored, is the solution secure?
dataSecurity.answer: Your data is stored on servers located in Europe and we follow best practices for data protection to ensure total security. Additionally, we only store information strictly necessary to support the platform's operation.

exportData.question: How can I export data from DEGIRO?
exportData.answer1: To correctly export data from DEGIRO you need to export 2 files (Account and Transactions).

accountFile.title: Extract "Account" file:
accountFile.step1: Inbox >> "Portfolio Summary" >> Select start date (since DEGIRO account creation) and end date to current date at the time of Export
accountFile.step2: Click the "download" button and select the ".xls" format

transactionsFile.title: Extract "Transactions" file:
transactionsFile.step1: Inbox >> "Transactions" >> Select start date (since DEGIRO account creation) and end date to current date at the time of Export
transactionsFile.step2: Click the "download" button and select the ".xls" format
